90.heading: Kier, Udo.
90.title: Barb Wire [videorecording]
90.author: Polygram Filmed Entertainment ; a Propaganda Films/Dark Horse Entertainment production.
notes: 1 videodisc (118 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
DVD.
Cast: Pamela Anderson Lee, Temuera Morrison, Victoria Rowell, Jack Noseworthy, Xander Berkeley, Udo Kier, Steve Railsback.

Summary (from OCLC): Barb Wire is the sexiest, toughest mercenary in Steel Harbor, a city of chaos and crime. If you've got a problem, Barb Wire is the solution. When Axel Hood hits town on a mission, Barb is the only one who can help him get out alive, but will she assist the man who once betrayed her?
Special features: unrated version, sexy outtakes, theatrical trailer, photo gallery, and cast & crew filmographies.

112.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
112.title: "Rock Opera"
112.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
112.appears_in: p. 76-81 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 7 (Oct. 1980).
notes: Begins: "And so, during the worst crisis the garment industry had ever known, I arrived in New York City."

113.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
113.title: "Rock Opera"
113.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
113.appears_in: p. 73-78 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 8 (Nov. 1980).
notes: Begins: "A hot wind bathed our faces like the tongue of a dog."

114.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
114.title: "Rock Opera"
114.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
114.appears_in: p. 74-79 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 9 (Dec. 1980).
notes: "To be continued."

115.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
115.title: "Rock Opera"
115.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
115.appears_in: p. 76-79 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 10 (Jan. 1981).
notes: Begins: "The limousine carried us in its gleaming belly through the sulphurous swamps of Newark."
"To be continued."

116.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
116.title: "Rock Opera"
116.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
116.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).

117.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
117.title: "Rock Opera"
117.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
117.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: Begins: "As I watched, the monster came to life. Adolf Hitler opened his eyes and spoke."

118.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
118.title: "Rock Opera"
118.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
118.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 1 (Apr. 1981).
notes: Begins: The bucolic tranquility of the morning was shattered by gunfire, as Marxist Panda and Fascist Mouse waged war.

119.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
119.title: "Rock Opera"
119.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
119.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 2 (May 1981).

120.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
120.title: "Rock Opera"
120.author: by Rod Kierkegaard Jr
120.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 4 (July 1981).

121.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
121.title: "Rock Opera"
121.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
121.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 5 (Aug. 1981).
notes: Begins: I hear they're opening a new diet resort down the beach.

122.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
122.title: "Rock Opera"
122.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
122.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 7 (Oct. 1981).
notes: Begins: In a foolish attempt to stop my friend Marty from kidnapping the Miss Moral America semifinalists, I had followed General Banzai out across the Space Skuttle launchpad.
"To be continued."

123.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
123.title: "Rock Opera"
123.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
123.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 9 (Dec. 1981).

124.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
124.title: "Rock Opera"
124.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
124.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 10 (Jan. 1982).
notes: Begins: "Zen. For millions, maybe billions, of years we must have drifted through space sealed inside the Space Skuttle."
"To be continued."

125.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
125.title: "Rock Opera"
125.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
125.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 11 (Feb. 1982).

126.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
126.title: "Rock Opera"
126.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
126.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 12 (Mar. 1982).
notes: "We had awakened from our frozen sleep to find ourselves living in a dream world, but what price would our menacingly genial host extract for our lives?"

127.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
127.title: "Rock Opera"
127.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
127.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 7 (Oct. 1982).
notes: Begins: Condemned by circumstance to wander among the stars, Marty and I had stolen aboard an alien luxury liner, 'The Love Craft.'"

128.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
128.title: "Rock Opera"
128.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
128.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 12 (Mar. 1983).
notes: Begins: Marty and I had been on Barrakis, the infamous boot camp planet of the Imperial Star Guards, for less than two months, when our outfit was given its marching orders.

130.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
130.title: "Rock Opera"
130.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
130.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 5 (Aug. 1983).
notes: Begins: Wno whould have imagined, when our mammoth Star Force overran the tiny planet of the Nehi, that our invasion would turn out to be the biggest disaster in military history?

131.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
131.title: "Rock Opera"
131.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
131.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 6 (Sept. 1983).
notes: "Synopsis: After fleeing the planet of the Nehi, Marty and I had crashlanded on a mysterious planet of dark, foreboding fantasy, where we'd met a self-professed Faerie, Onan the Vegetarian."

132.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
132.title: "Rock Opera"
132.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
132.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 7 (Oct. 1983).

133.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
133.title: "Rock Opera"
133.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
133.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 8 (Nov. 1983).
notes: Begins: The three of us, Marty, the Elf-Maid and I, stood on a ledge overlooking a huge arena. As we watched, an electronic grid appeared on the floor, and a large gate floated lazily toward us.

134.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
134.title: "Rock Opera"
134.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
134.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 9 (Dec. 1983).
notes: "Synopsis: After my friend Marty had ingratiated himself to Lord Phagsbane with a stand-up comic routine of truly awful jokes, Pixelle and I were left alone to face the dangers of the electronic arena."

135.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
135.title: "Rock Opera"
135.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
135.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 10 (Jan. 1984).

136.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
136.title: "Rock Opera"
136.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
136.appears_in: p. 92-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 7, no. 11 (Feb. 1984).
notes: "Synopsis: After Pixelle's impetuousness caused us to be swallowed by an enormous dragon, we found ourselves inside his pancreas, which was unaccountably furnished in the most tasteless manner."

137.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
137.title: "Rock Opera"
137.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
137.appears_in: p. 93-96 in Heavy Metal, v. 9, no. 2 (May 1985).
notes: "To be continued."

138.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
138.title: "Rock Opera"
138.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
138.appears_in: p. 53-56 in Heavy Metal, v. 9, no. 4 (July 1985).
notes: Begins: "And so, the Betels took their final curtain call."

139.heading: Kierkegaard, Rod.
139.title: "Rock Operetta"
139.author: by Rod Kierkegaard, Jr
139.appears_in: p. 94-95 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 5 (Aug. 1982).
notes: "Trapped in a drug-induced illusion of home ownership, career goals, and high interest rates, in other words reality, I had gone berserk with a Ronco Weedeater and rescued Marty from his android groupies. New we were in his Flycar on our way to rescue Adeline Jones from the Deva."
"To be continued."

notes: Beatles parody.
